meanings.definition: In an inactive or lazy manner.
meanings.sent1: She sat idly on the bench, watching the birds.
meanings.sent2: He idly flipped through the pages of the book, not really reading.
meanings.sent3: The cat idly batted at a toy mouse, pretending to hunt.
meanings.sent4: Time idly slipped away as they lounged in the sun.
meanings.sent5: The clouds drifted idly across the sky, in no hurry to reach their destination.

meanings.definition: Without any particular purpose or reason.
meanings.sent1: He wandered idly around the park, enjoying the sunshine.
meanings.sent2: She chatted idly with her friend, not discussing anything important.
meanings.sent3: The wind idly rustled the leaves, as if whispering secrets.
meanings.sent4: The river idly meandered through the valley, taking its time.
meanings.sent5: The child idly doodled on the paper, lost in thought.

meanings.definition: Without producing any result or effect.
meanings.sent1: The machine beeped idly, indicating an error.
meanings.sent2: She stirred the mixture idly, not following the recipe.
meanings.sent3: The phone rang idly in the empty room, unanswered.
meanings.sent4: The words fell idly on deaf ears, unnoticed by the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The warning went idly ignored, leading to consequences.
